catalog_info.title: Nutrition and Public Health
catalog_info.notes: Clinical rounds with Nutrition Support Services at Children's Hospital are optional.
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: Introduction to the critical reading of technical nutrition and medical literature; surveys current issues in public health and public policy relating to nutrition. Critical analysis of different types of medical literature: historical monographs, metabolic laboratory observations, clinical case reports, epidemiological surveys, prospective randomized controlled trials, metaanalyses, and literature reviews. Prepares science and non-science concentrators to examine critically current controversies for themselves; requires active participation and presentation by students.
